original: Bergström, Nils Erik, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 31/3/02 i Voxna, Gävieb. 1., av insp. Gottlieb B. o. Anna Nilsson. G. 33 m. Gerda Margareta Hultgren. Barn: Barbro f. 34, Andreas 38, Magnus 43. — Stud:ex. i Falun 21, med. kand. i Upps. 25 o. med. lic. där 29. Assist :läk. v. Umeå las. kir. avd. 26, v. Norrtälje las. 28, e. läk. v. Upps. hosp. o. asyl 29, assist :läk. o. tf. undiläk. v. Lidköp. las. 29-30, und :läk. v. Mössebergs sanat. 30-31, e. o. samt tf. aman. v. Seraf :-las. poliklin. f. öron-, näs- o. hals-sjukd. fyra mån. 31-32, e. läk. o. tf. und :läk. v. Sundsvalls las. kir. avd. 32-33, tf. und :läk. v. Kristianistads las. kir. avd. 33, förste und :läk. v. Mariestads das. 33-34, andre und:läk. v. Halmstads las. 35, förste dito 35-37, e. l’äk. v. Aikad. sjukh. i Upps. öronavd. 37, klinilkaman. där 38-40, e. läk. o. und:läk. v. Sahlgr. ’sjukh. öronavd. 40-44, bitr. las :läk. v. Örebro las. öronavd. 44-46, prakt. läk. i Gbg sed. 46.
translated: Bergström, Nils Erik, practicing physician, Gothenburg, b. March 31, 1902 in Voxna, Gävleborg County, first child of Inspector Gottlieb B. and Anna Nilsson. Married in 1933 to Gerda Margareta Hultgren. Children: Barbro b. 1934, Andreas b. 1938, Magnus b. 1943. Graduated from high school in Falun in 1921, received a Bachelor's degree in medicine from Uppsala in 1925 and a medical degree there in 1929. Worked as an assistant physician at the surgical department of Umeå Hospital in 1926, Norrtälje Hospital in 1928, Uppsala Hospital and Asylum in 1929. Also worked as an assistant physician and temporary substitute physician at Lidköping Hospital in 1929 and 1930, physician at Mösseberg Sanatorium from 1930 to 1931, and also held the position of acting assistant physician at the Serafim Hospital's polyclinic for ear, nose, and throat diseases for four months in 1931 and 1932. Worked as a physician and temporary substitute physician at the surgical department of Sundsvall Hospital from 1932 to 1933, temporary substitute physician at the surgical department of Kristianstad Hospital in 1933, first substitute physician at Mariestad Hospital from 1933 to 1934, second substitute physician at Halmstad Hospital in 1935, and first substitute physician there from 1935 to 1937. Worked as a physician at Akademiska Hospital in Uppsala in the ear department from 1937 to 1940, and was a clinical assistant there from 1938 to 1940. Worked as a physician and substitute physician at Sahlgrenska Hospital in the ear department from 1940 to 1944, and was an assistant physician at Örebro Hospital's ear department from 1944 to 1946. Became a practicing physician in Gothenburg in 1946.
